artificer.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per artificer level after 1st
artificer.tools: Thieves' tools, two other tools of your choice
artificer.skills: Choose three from Arcana, Deception, History, Investigation, Medicine, Nature, Religion, and Sleight of Hand
artificer.equipment1: (a) a handaxe and a light hammer or (b) any two simple weapons
artificer.equipment3: (a) scale mail or (b) studded leather armor and in addition you get thieves' tools and a dungeoneer's pack
artificer.quickbuild: You can make a artificer quickly by following these suggestions. First put your highest ability score in Dexterity, followed by Inteligence and Constitution
artificer.levelingtable: **[1]** Artificer Specialist,	Magic Item Analysis  **[2]** Tool Expertise, Wondrous Invention  **[3]** Artificer Specialist feature, Spellcasting  **[4]** Ability Score Improvement, Infuse Magic  **[5]** Superior Attunement, Wondrous Invention  **[6]** Mechanical Servant  **[8]** Ability Score Improvement  **[9]** Artificer Specialist Feature  **[10]** Wondrous Invention  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[14]** Artificer Specialist Feature  **[15]** Superior Attunement, Wondrous Invention  **[16]** Ability Score Improvement  **[17]** Artificer Specialist Feature  **[18]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Soul of Artifice, Wondrous Invention

barbarian.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d12 (or 7) + your Constitution modifier per barbarian level after 1st
barbarian.skills: Choose two from Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, and Survival
barbarian.equipment1: (a) a greataxe or (b) any martial melee weapon
barbarian.equipment2: (a) two handaxes or (b) any simple weapon
barbarian.equipment3: An explorer’s pack and four javelins
barbarian.quickbuild: You can make a barbarian quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Strength, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the outlander background.
barbarian.levelingtable: **[1]** Rage, Unarmored Defense  **[2]** Reckless Attack, Danger Sense  **[3]** Primal Path  **[4]** Ability Score Improvement  **[5]** Extra Attack, Fast Movement  **[6]** Path Feature  **[7]** Feral Instinct  **[8]** Ability Score Improvement  **[9]** Brutal Critical (1 die)  **[10]** Path Feature  **[11]** Relentless Rage  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[13]** Brutal Critical (2 dice)  **[14]** Path Feature  **[15]** Persisent Rage  **[16]** Ability Score  **[17]** Brutal Critical  **[18]** Indomitable Might  **[19]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Primal Champion

bard.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per bard level after 1st
bard.weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords
bard.tools: Three musical instruments of your choice
bard.equipment1: (a) a rapier, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
bard.equipment2: (a) a Diplomat's Pack or (b) an Entertainer's Pack
bard.equipment3: (a) a lute or (b) any other musical instrument in addition you get Leather armor and a dagger
bard.quickbuild: You can make a bard quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Dexterity. Second, choose the entertainer background. Third, choose the dancing lights and vicious mockery cantrips, along with the following 1st-level spells: charm person, detect magic, healing word, and thunderwave.
bard.levelingtable: **[1]** Spellcasting, Bardic Inspiration (d6)  **[2]** Jack of All Trades, Song of Rest (d6)  **[3]** Bard College, Expertise  **[4]** Ability Score Improvement  **[5]** Bardic Inspiration (d8), Font of Inspiration  **[6]** Countercharm, Bard College feature  **[8]** Ability Score Improvement  **[9]** Song of rest (d10)  **[10]** Bardic Inspiration (d10), Expertise, Magical Secrets  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[13]** Song of Rest (d10)  **[14]** Magical Secrets, Bard College feature  **[15]** Bardic Inspiration (d12)  **[16]** Ability Score Improvement  **[17]** Song of Rest (d12)  **[18]** Magical Secrets  **[19]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Superior Inspiration

bloodhunter.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per blood hunter level after 1st
bloodhunter.skills: Choose two from Athletics, Acrobatics, Arcana, Insight, Investigation, and Survival
bloodhunter.equipment1: (a) a martial weapon or (b) two simple weapons
bloodhunter.equipment2: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) hand crossbow and 20 bolts
bloodhunter.equipment3: (a) studded leather armor or (b) scale mail armor  an explorer’s pack
bloodhunter.quickbuild: You can make a blood hunter quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on whether you want to focus on melee weapons, or ranged and finesse weapons. Make Wisdom your next highest if you plan to focus on the potency of blood curses and mystical power. Choose a higher Constitution next if you wish to use Crimson Rite on multiple weapons or want to have extra hit points to burn on amplifying blood curses. Then, select the Haunted One or Acolyte background.
bloodhunter.levelingtable: **[1]** Hunter's Bane, Crimson Rite  **[2]** Fighting Style, Blood Maledict  **[3]** Blood Hunter Order  **[4]** Ability Score Improvement  **[5]** Extra Attack  **[6]** Blood Maledict (2/rest) **[7]** Order Feature  **[8]** Ability Score Improvement  **[9]** Grim Psychometry  **[10]** Dark Velocity  **[11]** Order Feature, Blood Maledict (3/rest)  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[14]** Hardened Soul  **[15]** Order Feature  **[16]** Ability Score Improvement  **[17]** Blood Maledict (4/rest)  **[18]** Order Feature  **[19]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Sanguine Mastery

cleric.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per cleric level after 1st
cleric.skills: Choose two from History, Insight, Medicine, Persuasion, and Religion
cleric.equipment1: (a) a mace or (b) a warhammer (if proficient)
cleric.equipment2: (a) scale mail, (b) leather armor, or (c) chain mail (if proficient)
cleric.equipment3: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon  (a) a priest’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack  A shield and a holy symbol
cleric.quickbuild: You can make a cleric quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Strength or Constitution. Second, choose the acolyte background.
cleric.levelingtable: **[1]** Spellcasting, Divine Domain  **[2]** Channel Divinity (1/rest), Divine Domain Feature  **[4]** Ability Score Improvement  **[5]** Destroy Undead (CR 1/2)  **[6]** Channel Divinity (2/rest), Divine Domain Feature  **[8]** Ability Score Improvement, Destroy Undead (CR 1), Divine Domain Feature  **[10]** Divine Intervention  **[11]** Destroy Undead (CR 2)  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[14]** Destroy Undead (CR 3)  **[16]** Ability Score Improvement  **[17]** Destroy Undead (CR 4), Divine Domain Feature  **[18]** Channel Divinity (3/rest)  **[19]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Divine Intervention Improvement

druid.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per druid level after 1st
druid.armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields (druids will not wear armor or use shields made of metal)
druid.weapons: Clubs, daggers, darts, javelins, maces, quarterstaffs, scimitars, sickles, slings, spears
druid.skills: Choose two from Arcana, Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival
druid.equipment1: (a) a wooden shield or (b) any simple weapon
druid.equipment2: (a) a scimitar or (b) any simple melee weapon
druid.equipment3: Leather armor, an explorer’s pack, and a druidic focus
druid.quickbuild: You can make a druid quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the hermit background.
druid.levelingtable: **[1]** Druidic, Spellcasting  **[2]** Wild Shape, Druid Circle  **[4]** Wild Shape Improvement, Ability Score Improvement  **[6]** Druid Circle Feature  **[8]** Wild Shape Improvement, Ability Score Improvement  **[10]** Druid Circle Feature  **[12]** Ability Score Improvement  **[14]** Druid Circle Feature  **[16]** Ability Score Improvement  **[18]** Timeless Body, Beast Spells  **[19]** Ability Score Improvement  **[20]** Archdruid

fighter.hit_points_at_higher_levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per fighter level after 1st
fighter.skills: Choose two skills from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival
fighter.equipment1: (a) chain mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows
fighter.equipment2: (a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
fighter.equipment3: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes  (a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
fighter.quickbuild: You can make a fighter quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on whether you want to focus on melee weapons or on archery (or finesse weapons). Your next-highest score should be Constitution, or Intelligence if you plan to adopt the Eldritch Knight martial archetype. Second, choose the soldier background.
